meanings.definition: To remove or separate by washing or rinsing
meanings.sent1: She was eluting the dirt from the fabric by washing it thoroughly.
meanings.sent2: The scientist eluted the impurities from the sample using a special solvent.
meanings.sent3: The laundry detergent was so effective that it seemed to be eluting the stains effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: His kindness acted as a gentle stream, eluting away the bitterness in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed with such force, eluting everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To dissolve or extract a substance from a solid material
meanings.sent1: The chemist was eluting the compound from the mixture to analyze its properties.
meanings.sent2: The solvent was able to elute the pigment from the solid material effectively.
meanings.sent3: The potion seemed to have magical powers, eluting the essence of the rare herb instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her words eluted the truth from his guarded heart, revealing his deepest feelings.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight gently eluted the colors from the painting, making them vibrant and alive.

meanings.definition: The process of separating or purifying a substance by washing or rinsing
meanings.sent1: The eluting of the chemicals was a crucial step in the purification process.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use eluting in laboratories to obtain pure substances for experiments.
meanings.sent3: The eluting of the ingredients in the recipe made it taste even better.
meanings.sent4: The eluting of the impurities from the water ensured its cleanliness.
meanings.sent5: The eluting of the colors in the tie-dye shirt created a beautiful pattern.
